commit message: Initial version. Got some classes and just finished the rename from HelloAndroid.
Moved stuff around a bit, will now try to write a schedule class.
Added tent list and ScheduleData* classes.
Added a bogus schedule for just two tents, time to start rendering it.
It now displays a proper schedule and description. I still have to replace the ScheduleData class with code that parses a .xml file or something like that.
Enabled Internet access from the application, experimenting with the URL class, added a title.
Got a lot of parsing code already, but not using it for rendering yet.
Rendering from XML \o/
Small fixes: don't print the gap length in gaps and ignore clicks on headers/gaps.
Added Python script to convert .ics files to suitable input. Only tested on Lowlands files so far.
No longer centering vertically, this was causing weird and ugly rendering.
Added black-gray-black coloured cells.
Making the rows a bit higher. Although this is less space efficient, testing the app on a real phone showed me that 32 pixels is too small to be able to accurately tap on a cell.
Added ScheduleScroller, which will hopefully help me with horizontal scrolling.
Now using Unix timestamps instead of the ISO-8601 format in the time fields.
Added parsing for Unix timestamps in input files. This makes the loading quite a bit faster, now rendering really is the bottleneck.
Now using an onClick listener instead of a MotionEvent to detect clicks, this allows for easier scrolling.
Very basic X+Y scrolling.
Fixed a bug in the scrolling code (odd behaviour when dragging from outside the schedule area).
Scroll limits on the right+bottom as well.
Parsing <itemDescription> elements.
Added a Perl script (hack of the day) to scrape descriptions from the Lowlands website. Not perfect, but enough to have more useful testfiles.
Renamed some classes, added BlockScheduleClock class, added flags to SimpleScroller (enable just h/v scrolling).
Split off rendering logic into BlockScheduleViewer, and automatically scrolling the clock with the schedule itself.
Added scrolling to the information dialog.
Support for loading linkType/itemLink tags.
Added link buttons.
Support for link buttons in info dialogs.
The column with tent names now never scrolls out of the screen.
Preloading icons at load time now.
Added website URL fetching to the hackish Lowlands parser and fixed onClick handling of link icons.
Added Last.fm URL guessing to the Lowlands generator.
Now actually showing enough clock for the given schedule instead of just a fixed 12 hours.
Using an AbsoluteLayout instead of a set of LinearLayouts to show the schedule, this seems to be a great performance improvement.
Adding database code, not actually using it yet.

Picking this up after about three months (I now have a handset to test this on):

* Some database code I started working on but didn't finish yet.
* Sanitizing the code. Using an Application object for some global state (just the database ATM), for a start.
* Preparing for multiple activities in the program.
Look what I found, inner classes!
Sanitized some more code, that's enough for now. We're back to a sane number of classes again.
Removed bogus testing stuff, and now catching orientation changes and preventing full activity reloads when they happen.
Enable automatic rotation (may make this a setting later?) and updating SimpleScroller on orientation changes when we're suddenly past max[xy].
Now finally remembering reminder flags in the database.
Some kind of exception catching (but not any kind of sane error reporting). Also disabling automatic rotation because it's a bit trigger-happy, will probably make it a setting at some point.
Moved XML parsing into a subclass, preparing to support other file formats.
Loader for xcal files. Works quite well, but having problems with rw data.
Now also adding all items to the global id->item map, this fixes problems with the database data.

Using a TreeSet to have all items in a line sorted by time/order, even when the input file has them sorted differently.

This fixes odd colours and will also be useful for other views.
Added ShuffleLayout. Somewhat broken when moving things around too quickly, I guess I'm not giving the Views enough time to update themselves. Disabled the shuffling for now.
Mark 'Remind me' events with a green background colour.
ShuffleLayout is now enabled and seems to work well. One can reorder the schedule by dragging tents around.
Added preferences, now the block size and reshuffling are configurable.
Added somewhat fragile auto-detection code for the two file formats supported so far.
Upgraded database version, now including atime and original URL information. I need this information to add a chooser.
Quick and dirty ChooserActivity. Also saving the schedule titles in the database now.
Added progress indicator, and now also properly doing the file parsing in a separate (non-UI) thread to make the dialog actually work.

Now using schedule titles in the chooser, and caching schedules in the application object. Should be good for normal use, since it's unlikely that one would ever keep more than 2/3 schedules cached, and it saves a lot of time.
BlockScheduleActivity now makes baby Jesus cry, but at least the user gets a shiny error dialog if something went wrong at load time.
Database connection handling cleanup.
Just cleaned up imports...
Added TimeTable view.
Added run-time switching between the timetable and block schedule views.
TimeTable is now a RelativeLayout, which means the table fills the whole screen and the tent list is overlapping it. IMHO it looks a bit nicer (and slightly more space-efficient).
Added 'default view' preference.
Split off the dialog with event information into a new class, I need it in other views than just the block schedule.
Now showing an EventDialog when one clicks on a timetable row.
Scroll back to the top when switching tents.
Added proper blockschedule icon (and using a slightly more suitable one for the timetable).
Now with a real icon, based on the OpenIntents timesheet application.

Stupid Eclipse is trying to check in class files all the time. I hope I
managed to stop this now.
Added feature for rating events using my own simple StarsView (since RatingBar doesn't fit well in the dialog :-/).
Added NowNext screen.
Made ItemRow a subclass of TimeTable. Somewhat dirty code reuse, maybe. Also showing items with remind set to true in bold.
Added a textbox to the chooser to open new URLs instead of just the ones that are in the database already.
Reload the schedule list whenever the chooser comes to the foreground to keep it up to date.
Dragging horizontally now switches from tent to tent in the time table. Quit a hack, and sometimes not triggering very well yet.

Cache an offline copy of every downloaded schedule and use it if the
Internet connection is not available.
Pentabarf parser! \o/
Working on usable multiday support. Most stuff seems to be done, except for UI.
Day selection UI. Also starting to use the Giggity name.

Use cache storage instead of file storage for local schedule copies. This
lets the user purge the cache without losing all settings and *may* also
let the OS do some cleaning when necessary.

Handle day_change data in Pentabarf files (and for other files, guess
6:00 is a better day separator than 0:00).

Also moved some stuff around in Schedule.java without any changes.
Updated database version, preparing for storing last viewed day/date.
Remember the last day the user looked at.

Renamed from Deoxide to Giggity.

Deoxide was derived from Oxegen, an Irish music festival which back in 2008
inspired me to make this program (since their paper schedule booklet was
worthless (and was sold separately for EUR 10 or so!!)). To avoid trademark
issues, I'm renaming it to Giggity. Even though I now primarily use this
for conferences, having 'gig' in the name seems sensible.

Obviously I have *nothing* to do with Glenn Quagmire. :>
Omit 'empty' days from getDays() response.

In BlockSchedule, render empty rows instead of skipping them (and messing
up the alignment of following rows).

More intelligent caching: Use (If-)Modified-Since HTTP headers and give a
more reasonable error message when offline and trying to load something
that is not in cache yet.
Added QR code scanner integration. \o/
Bugfix in 304 handling code. (Don't reset timestamp of cached file to 0.)
Show current day in title bar.

Added browser icon for links, try to show the current time in block
schedules. (Not yet updated after initial rendering.)
Experimenting with a different colour scheme.

Added lax (i.e. no) HTTPS certificate checking since URLConnection by
default seems more strict about the penta.fosdem.org certs than the browser
is. :-/ (Not using the same set of CA certs?)

Adding block schedule styles to settings. Need more styles now, and I have
no clue about colours..
Refresh every minute.
Context menu, to allow the user to remove/refresh remembered items.

Basic search functionality. It's a pretty ugly grep, no full text search.
The UI now needs some work, ATM it just shows titles of matching events.

Somewhat better rendering of search results, and showing event details
like everywhere else.
Fixed crashbug on switching days after using the search functionality.
Fixed crashbug on using SSL on pre-2.3 Android versions.
Move colours for clock and item hilights to colour schemes.

Split off Schedule.Item ListAdapter/etc into ScheduleListActivity, I want
to use it for TimeTable+NowNext as well.

Allow showing headers/separations in ScheduleListActivity by feeding it an
untyped list. If a list item is a string, it will be shown as an unselectable
header.
Adding Copyright/GPL header to all Java source files.

Version 0.7. About to do my first Market upload ever, fingers crossed.
Simple seeding with the FOSDEM 2011 schedule. Will make that a little
fancier later.
